event: Earliest human presence in present-day Austria
Celtic cultures flourish in the Alpine and Danube regions
Roman Empire incorporates the region as provinces along the Danube
Roman authority collapses during the Migration Period
Frankish rule integrates the region into the Carolingian Empire
March of Austria is established as a frontier territory
Austria becomes a duchy under the Babenberg dynasty
Habsburg dynasty gains control of Austria
Habsburgs begin long dominance of the Holy Roman Empire
First Ottoman siege of Vienna marks frontier between empires
Second Ottoman siege of Vienna is defeated, securing Central Europe
Maria Theresa ascends the throne, reforming the Habsburg state
Austrian Empire is proclaimed
Congress of Vienna reshapes Europe after the Napoleonic Wars
Austria-Hungary is formed as a dual monarchy
Assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand triggers World War I
Austria-Hungary collapses; Republic of Austria is created
Austria is annexed by Nazi Germany
Austria is reestablished after World War II
Austria regains full sovereignty and declares permanent neutrality
